entry.title: Tour shows goods from the Glide Educational Forest

entry.title: WINSTON WOMAN JAILED ON ASSAULT CHARGE

entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY FLOODING EVENT RESPONSE CONTINUES
entry.summary: March 22, 2025 10:00 a.m. Douglas County continues to recover following the flooding event on Sunday. A county release said county staff and local private contractors continue to work on shoring up mudslides, repairing and cleaning up roads, repairing utilities, assessing and estimating damage and more. Several county parks were impacted by the recent storm....

entry.title: INMATE ESCAPES COURT HEARING, CAPTURED IN HOMELESS CAMPING AREA
entry.summary: March 22, 2025 6:40 a.m. An inmate at the Douglas County Jail escaped following a courtroom hearing Friday afternoon but was captured a short time later after a large-scale police search. entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 3.21.25
entry.summary: A two-part program with Drain Interim City Administrator Ken Strobeck talks about the flood damage in his community, then State Representative Virgle Osborn talks about legislation currently being considered in Salem.

entry.title: REEDSPORT HOLDING RIBBON CUTTING FOR PUMP STATION
entry.summary: March 21, 2025 10:50 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: The City of Reedsport will hold a ribbon cutting ceremony to celebrate the completion of the Forest Hills Pump Station. The event will be held on Wednesday afternoon at 2:00 p.m. at Bicentennial Park. A city release said the Forest Hills Pump Station began in June...

entry.title: DAN BAIN NAMED MALE FIRST CITIZEN AT CHAMBER BANQUET
entry.summary: March 21, 2025 10:30 a.m. Dan Bain was named the male First Citizen of 2024 at the Roseburg Area Chamber of Commerce 70th annual awards dinner and meeting of its membership on Thursday night. entry.title: GLENDALE SCHOOLS IN SESSION FRIDAY
entry.summary: March 21, 2025 6:00 a.m. The Glendale School District is in session on Friday. Superintendent Bridget McMillen said classes will be on their regular schedule. The district does not normally operate on Fridays but is doing so this week as a make-up day after being closed on Monday, due to rain and flooding around Douglas...

entry.title: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR MOUNTAIN AREAS THROUGH 5:00 A.M. SATURDAY
entry.summary: March 21, 2025 4:00 a.m. A Winter Weather Advisory remains in effect through 5:00 a.m. Saturday for mountain areas in parts of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said snow is expected, which could be heavy at times. Snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches are forecast, except locally up to 2 feet...

entry.title: UMPQUA OREGON HUNTERS ASSOCIATION BANQUET
entry.summary: March 21, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Umpqua Oregon Hunters Association banquet is coming soon, and tickets are still available. The 25th annual event will take place on Sunday, April 6th at 4:00 p.m. at Seven Feathers Casino Resort in Canyonville. The doors open at 4:00 p.m. with dinner served at 6:00 p.m. Prime rib and...

entry.title: Waldron’s Outdoor Sports Relocating to Expanded Store on NE Stephens Street
entry.summary: Waldron’s Outdoor Sports in Roseburg is moving to a larger location at 450 NE Stephens Street, opening April 1. The new store will feature an expanded archery range, firearms selection, and fishing section. The current location remains open through March 27 with a blowout sale ahead of the move.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 3.20.25
entry.summary: A two segment program: Myrtle Creek Police Chief Jonathan Brewster talks about flood damage in that community and what Sunday was like. In part two, State Representative Alek Skarlatos joins us live from Salem to talk about gun legislation he opposes and a group of tax relief meaasures that Republicans are supporting.
